lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons and Dragons and can't listen to a count off screen when we're going to go live. But I appreciate the effort guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nobody could hear me say, "Scaramucci, I fucked up."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Samuel, you wanna talk about this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Black Lotus.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is Kama Sutra.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That is Magic: the Gathering.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A classic! That is the world's most famous Magic: the Gathering card!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Reverse cowgirl.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Magic: the Gathering.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Strangely, yeah. White deck.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She Wolf.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She Wolf is Magic: the Gathering.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, that's--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: God damn it! (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Lone Wolf.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's Magic: the Gathering. I'm just doing B on every question.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Illicit Auction.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's Magic: the Gathering.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're correct! The Angry Pirate.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a Sam Riegel original.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe two more. Two more. The Curled Angel.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's so close to another phrase. Let's call that the Kama Sutra.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Correct! The Mud Hole.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (high voice) Magic: the Gathering?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The last one, last one: Excavation.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ew!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Marvel Puzzle Quest! No! Magic: the Gathering - Puzzle Quest

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yay, Puzzle Quest! This time Magic. Well done, Sam. Well done, Liam!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was educated.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, moving on. Laura, we had some updates you said as far as merch goes?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Merchandise!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She's playing with her giant trash bag of dice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Also, some other stuff.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nice and vague.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's see, next up. GenCon live. We are at the tail end of any available tickets for the show. So if you haven't got one yet and you're still planning to be around or near Indianapolis for GenCon and want to come see, get it quickly. We're about to close that out. Looking forward to seeing everyone there who's coming, it's going to be fun and depending on the next couple episodes, I'm real curious to where it ends up when we get to GenCon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So it's going to be a canon episode?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, it's a canon episode. It's going to be the next episode.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we all die at the live show?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If one of us dies tonight, do we not go to GenCon?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, pretty much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (groaning)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If you die, we will lower you from above like an angel on a fly reel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On the Peter Pan wire setup?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With some asshole swinging you from side to side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just sending you across the audience.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (yelling) I want to get down, I can't feel my legs!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an acrobatics check!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's going to be so fucking great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So yes. Look forward to that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like how we all assumed it was going to be Sam that was dead and flying above the audience.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Talks Machina, once again on Tuesdays. We'll have a discussion about this episode next week and on Tuesday at 7:00pm Pacific, with our wonderful host Brian Foster on Twitch and Alpha.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is next week the one that they're off, though?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are they off next week?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think they're taking a week off, no? The week after?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Both? Both. The week after Gencon we will be streaming the panel that we did at GenCon. I feel like Brian is going to be in New York for Ashley's birthday right now. He flew out today.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So not next Tuesday, but the Tuesday after.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He'll chime in on Twitter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Follow Talks Machina on Twitter for updates about what's happening next episode.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We planned this out

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Last couple things: Sagas of Sundry. The final episode of Dread is now up on Alpha, and we'll see the finale of that crazy, crazy ride.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's so good. It's scurry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's amazing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I watch the show with the lights on 'cause it creeps me out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I believe our last announcement today is the birthday of one fabulous goliath barbarian.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Once a year, y'all. Once a year.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Travis Willingham, happy birthday, buddy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Happy birthday, bb!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I can't die today, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where's the cake?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's in my stomach.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's no cake, y'all.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But where's the cake?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, that was awesome.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have a little cake eraser. Do you want the cake eraser for the game? Hang on. Where is it? Where did I put it? Happy birthday!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's a little Pike cake!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And welcome back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We didn't say anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 107 episodes later.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's all it took. And it's the last time it'll ever happen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Lulling you into a false sense of security.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Last we left off, you had found yourself in Vasselheim, went to the Trial Forge to speak with Earthbreaker Groon, discovered what would be required to attempt to make contact with Kord, and you made communion with the Raven Queen, and in declaring your complete faith in her she offered a piece of her essence to give you the third seed with which to make a third Divine Trammel, and with you all falling asleep within Scanlan's Magnificent Mansion, you cast True Polymorph on yourself to take the form of a planetar and did whatever you did in that form as you all went to sleep that evening.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Except that while he was checking out his junk in the mirror-- heavenly junk-- I shut the door behind Keyleth and I. I don't think we should go another couple of days in silence.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Has it been days?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just barely.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Feels like an eternity.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know that you are angry, and I am just-- I'm sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, we've always had the problem of you having one too many ladies in your life, right? (laughs) It's hard to compete with a god.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've done a lot of stupid things in my life, and I've never had any regrets, really. I do know the chance you took on me, and I've confirmed your worst fears, and then some.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not your fault.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Regardless, I am sorry, and I regret that I'm not outright dead already and that you have to stare at this walking pantomime of a life in front of you, but Kiki, I'm grateful for the time I have left to look on you, and I am grateful to fight for your future. And I'm grateful for that chance you took on me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I wouldn't take it back. You taught me how to take chances. (laughs) Can I ask you a question? What exactly was the deal that you made with the Raven Queen? Was it when we slew Vecna, or defeated him? I have a feeling semantics are becoming increasingly more important.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She offered me a way back, and it was the only way back. I wasn't coming back, not after that. Not without her blessing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Even if we found a way, you wouldn't take it. To reverse the deal. I'm not asking. I'm just confirming.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't want to leave, but there are some things that I will not test. Hey. I do have faith in her. And I have faith in you and what you'll do. (sighs) God, I feel so stupid.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's fitting, really. You can protect that plane. I'll be here to protect this one. I mean, if these past few days have taught us anything, it's death isn't the end. I just don't want to forget. If Sprigg could forget the names of his party members that he died alongside-- he ran-- never mind. What's going to happen in a hundred or hundreds or even a thousand years? I don't want to forget this. What if there comes a day when I don't even recognize the name Vox Machina anymore?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't believe that will happen. You're going to live a long life. Yes. And you will love again. And you will lead. And you will be loved, because who cannot love you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can name a few.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No one of any worth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm grateful for you, and I always will be. And I'm grateful for any second that we have left. And I don't want to spend any more being angry at you. And I'm sorry that I was.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You don't want me to go?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs) Of course not.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hey, I'm fucking cold. Will you give me a hug?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. It's the weirdest thing, by the way, you being cold. I mean, it's just something to get used to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't have any clever closer. I'm just going to crawl into bed and go to sleep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The morning comes. You all come to consciousness within Scanlan's Magnificent Mansion. And find breakfast of various grains and oats and quinoa.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Lentils.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What do you mean lentils? What is that? What is a lentil? Is it a leaf? Is it a bean?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No one really knows, to be fair.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why on god's green earth is it even here? I don't understand.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Lentils are here to punish us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes. We have done something terribly wrong, and now we must eat of these.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That makes sense an hour from now when I get punished in the loo.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are punished by that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm sorry. This head cold mixed with crying is bad.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It gets you, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's rough.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that's what happened to me that day.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's the worst!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, your voice is super sexy tonight, so that's good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (raspy singing) Smelly cat, smelly cat--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (raspy singing) What are they feeding you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so as you finish your meals in the morning, prepare yourself for the actions of the coming day, what do you wish to do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't fucking know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we going to this volcano under the water?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, right? That's where we have to go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We need to be able to swim.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And we need to be immune to poison.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, so if we have a Heroes' Feast, that will take care of one thing. And I have two chalices because we never used the one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We should save at least one for a certain fight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, obviously.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You can make us breathe underwater, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, I can.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All of us? Even Trinket?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (unsure) Yes?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And Pike?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well Pike, goes up-- yes, don't forget! "I can prepare the feast for you guys. That way, you "don't have to spend a spell of yours for it. As you guys are on this mission to go make this-- I can be "help-- I think I need to stay here for now to shepherd both the people in my temple of the "Everlight with whatever words I can keep them calm under this chaos in the city."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! Pike, but what if Vasselheim is attacked?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then I can let you know. I also have a Sending spell prepared, so if anything happens, I "can let you know immediately. As long as you're on this plane."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's so convenient!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's what clerics are here for!" She punches you in the shoulder.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I have something of yours, at least until we see each other again? (sounds of distress)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course, Grog!" And she comes up to you and, "Let me see your axe real fast."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh, the Bloodaxe?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There you go! Mary Poppins handbag.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She hefts it and takes a little bit of her fading blue hair at the tip and carves off a little piece of it, hands the axe back to you, and very deftly braids it into a small braid, ties it off, and hands it to you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (gasps) It's the sweetest thing ever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, but seriously don't eat it, please."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's really creepy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Grog! No! No."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I tie it onto my necklace.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. "Please be safe. And if anything happens, I'm going to let you know as soon as "possible."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh man, it's going to hurt not to have you with us, though. Oh, well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You guys will be fine. Better we save our strength for whatever's out there."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, and if Vasselheim is attacked, you don't go saving the city all by yourself.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Seriously.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know what you're like.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Why would I steal the fun from you?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's what I thought.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. Bye, Pike.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait no, she has to prepare the Heroes' Feast for us before we say goodbye.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hi, Pike!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You hand her the chalice, and she prepares the feast within the mansion, so what little bit of for some of you may have been an unsatisfying breakfast this morning is quickly taken over by the fantastically tasting feast of such a holy spread. Taking the hour to eat it, all of you guys get the benefits of Heroes' Feast.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No lentils, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a bowl of lentils for those who may want it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so as the Heroes' Feast says here--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Immune to fear and poison and advantage on wisdom checks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And you roll 2d10 extra.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wisdom saving throws.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm going to roll 2d10 for you guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you guys want food now, or do you want to wait until the break?

lines.name: TRAVIS, MATT
lines.text: Let's wait until the break.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll take a slightly early break in the long run.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's lucky. Okay, so there you go. That's 18 additional hit points.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That can regenerate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. That's the maximum of your hit points for the next 24 hours, so keep that in mind, folks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, dope!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How long do your inspiring speeches last?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that is an excellent question. How long do my speeches--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Said Kathleen Turner.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Said Katharine Hepburn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Inspiring Leader. A creature can't gain temporary hit points from this feat again until it has finished a short or long rest. So you have temporary hit points until your next long rest, essentially.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. So can I double up on that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Give us more hit points?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can. It'll be temporary hit points on top of that, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh. Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're probably not going to fight anything, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Since my voice is completely shot, and I don't want to do a speech.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, but we need it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I am going to do--

lines.name: MARISHA, SAM
lines.text: An interpretive dance! (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Of us swimming through the volcano, and then going underground and shielding ourselves, and then fighting! And then Grog's forging the trammels! (enthusiastic a cappella music)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wow, that happened.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm amazed that took over a hundred episodes. I've been waiting for the interpretive dance for a long time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay, how many did we get from that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So everyone gets 18 temporary hit points, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is that max goes up 18?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, temporary hit points, so as soon as you take damage, they go away from the temporary first. Temporary never come back. Then you have the maximum hit point bonus.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So 18 max up and then an 18 on top of that that goes away once you get hit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But do I get sneak attack damage, or is it also a critical hit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Raven Queen taketh away. All right, so as you guys are all sitting there watching Keyleth dance while she eats, while you're eating, it's a unique display. You're prepared for the rest of your day, Pike says goodbye to everybody, gives you a hug. Says, "Be safe."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pike, will you do me a favor, and will you get word to Kaylie somehow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can do that, yeah."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tell her Dad's okay and saving the world again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She goes, "...Done!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, Pike?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I should have asked that long ago!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Probably, yeah!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Could you also do one of those to Tary?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, don't say, "Dad's okay, saving the world again." That won't make any sense to him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tell him we're all alive.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tell him we love him, and that we're okay for the time being.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Especially Scanlan. He's probably really concerned.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) You see this secondary dull flash and release of energy at her fingertips as she finishes the glyph.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are we doing this now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There we go, we have food now!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're doing it live! Can I have one slice of breakfast pizza?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is this, a restaurant?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jesus, what the fuck?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's like: hold on.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pelor, can I have one slice of breakfast pizza, please? (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This marker sucks balls!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Pike makes her way toward her temple. You guys are still within Scanlan's mansion, what are you doing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How are we traveling? And where are we going?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we Plane Shift?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Above the water, over to the volcano. How do we do this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a bit away from Vasselheim, if I remember. I did see a tree, right, that was near the town?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, so once we're there, do we know exactly what we're doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're diving down into the volcano, forging some trammels.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And the volcano's underwater. Is that what the schtick is with it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. It's on the floor, and you can notice it because across this open clear ocean, there is one column of black smoke that emits from the waves.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So it's an active volcano that we're diving into?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Underwater.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Solid.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Essentially.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're not going to get more of these before we forge the trams?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't think there's time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Remember, Delilah was already down there? She was in tunnels underground, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Somewhere. We don't know where, exactly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We don't know if she's at this forge?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, we don't know if she's there, we don't know if she's with Vecna.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The vision that you had, she was topside, and there was snow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, she was coming out of Thar Amphala.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, tunnels that burrowed beneath the city of Thar Amphala.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And she was coming out. She had both of her eyeballs back, and was like, "Ooh, it's "chilly." Bitch! Enjoying the winter snow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Two regular eyes?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Two regular eyes! Why do you think she keeps coming back? (gasps) Oh no.

lines.name: TRAVIS, LAURA, LIAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're nervous about everything, is that what we've come to?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know, maybe she made a deal similar to the deals we've made, but with Vecna.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would assume so.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, if gods can give us their blessing, why can't she have one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We should really tip 10%.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, at least!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know, be really generous.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look at this! You guys!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So we go. Right? Do we go to the shore and then out into the ocean on a ship?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We go to the shore, then we climb up the volcano, then we dive into the volcano?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The volcano is underneath the ocean.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But there's smoke coming out of it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Underneath the ocean.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. A trail of black, sooty, bubbly goodness.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We've only talked about it for four hours; it's okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought maybe the top was coming out of the water.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are volcanoes underwater, and this one is less burning smoke. It's the sulfuric gases and poisonous fumes of the various reactions and chemicals and pressure beneath.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You never watched behind the scenes on Titanic?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I got it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How do we get there?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We go to the shore.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I have a tree. I can get us there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Let's do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. With your things gathered, you all find your way, I imagine it's not too far of a walk from the Raven's Crest to a tree that is functional for this spell. It's on the southern border of the quarter that holds the Birthheart, the orchards and various trees there. You find yourselves a suitable tree, gather yourselves, steel yourselves. Now that the morning has come, the tension in the air of Vasselheim and the word that spreads of some sort of looming threat, though sourceless and directionless, definitely has built this air of fear and rush for preparation that surrounds you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have a question, sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did Pike come with us to send us off?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say sure! She walks you guys to the tree.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pike? You know you have-- what's it called you put on me one time? That Death Ward? Should we put that on one of us before we go, just in case it's super dangerous? One of the squishier ones? Does someone want Death Ward, so if you go down--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Put it on Vax.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think either Percy or I.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pass.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god, just kiss already!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh god! They do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Boulder-Parchment-Shears. Perfect opportunity.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Flip for it. Heads or tails?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Boulder-Parchment-Shears.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, come on.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Boulder-Parchment-Shears?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: One time. One, two, three, go!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Boulder always wins.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can give it to a few people." (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks, Pike! That's convenient.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm going to have to save some for Sending, just "in case."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, of course.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Those two.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mr. and Mrs. de Rolo.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay, this'll only last for eight hours, so travel quickly."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's Mr. and Mrs. Vex, let's be fair.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just in case.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You, too?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope! Nope. I like a little danger in my life.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is this going to be like the kraken fight? Are we going to be underwater fighting again?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I hope not.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You weren't there. We almost fucking died because you weren't there with us, Scanlan. I hated you at that moment.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Water under the bridge. Water under the kraken. We're on brighter horizons

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are arguing, she leans forward and beneath her breath finishes the incantation with the Death Ward, and you, Vex'ahlia, it sounds like a soft clinging of gentle metals in the back of your head, and as it hits this warmth hits your chest and then it sets in. It doesn't quite fade, it's like having a localized blanket held to your sternum. Who else would like one?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How many does she get?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say for the purposes of this, she can muster four.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scanlan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (raspy voice) How many does she get?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (mafia-style voice) How many you got?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you want one?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If you die, I'm going to be really upset.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: On my birthday? Come on! What are the chances?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's got that whole barbarian "knock me down, I get back up again" thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I get the fuck back up again! You're Hercules Mulligan!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's why he would be a rogue/barbarian, I think!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To the immediate right of you, there's a cliffside, maybe 200 feet from the edge of the town where there are carts going to and from. You can the large crane carrying large containers and large nets filled with caught fish from the bottom of the cliffside. People around noticed you emerge from a tree, and you can see about four or five of the various peasants and working folk stop in their tracks and stare at you, frozen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know, weird, right? Really weird.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hi!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This way, James." And he grabs his little kid's hand and the kid is slack-jawed watching you as he drags him off to the side. People start walking again and still glancing over their shoulder, they go about their business, keeping a very close eye.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe I should have found a tree less in the center of things.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'd rather be here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Still off to the side, but you did catch the eye of a few folk.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's commendable.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How would one go about finding out if you're being watched via magical means? Is there a way to do that other than if one is not a magic user? Is that a perception check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, there are actual spells designed for that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there spells designed to mask you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I don't think any of us have them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To mask you from scrying?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, so people can't see us. Do you know of anything like that, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've heard of such things, but I don't currently have one.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just curious.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Good question.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, because Vecna's fucking watching us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right now?!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, all the fucking time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're sure?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, right over there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we take a boat now? Or do we find some dolphins and ride out majestically?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we on the water?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we make our way to the shoreline?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, it's a couple hundred feet to get to the edge of the cliff. And these are sheer cliffs that drop off for 150, 200 feet or so before it hits very hard pebbled beaches. These aren't sandy beaches.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I stop everybody, saying, be careful. It looks like it could be a thousand feet, which is deceiving.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We all know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A thousand feet is so long.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So we're on cliffs facing the ocean, right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look down, and there are the rocky beaches, there are a number of large docks that jut out from the rocky beach, and you can see there are about five or six varying degrees of rickety winding wooden staircases that are built into the cliffside that lead from the top edge of the cliff down to the beach below. You can see a lot of workers are currently hauling large sacks, small crates and boxes, things that are too small to bring on the large winding cranes that they have on the edge as well. There are ships coming, there are ships going. It looks like this is a decent trade stop for cities along the shoreside here in Issylra.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do our elven eyes see? Can we see the smoke?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That was a Legolas reference, in case you were wondering.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not familiar with that reference.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A perception check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20. Glancing out at this distance, the sky itself is very cloudy, very gray. It's a very gray day. It's cold, it's chilly, the wind that's blowing is very faint, but it's enough to the point where snow is falling. There is a very faint mist in the distance. Either a storm is coming or a storm has passed that's preventing you from seeing any sign of a glimmer of the smoke. So you're not entirely certain the direction.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I tell if the storm is coming or the storm has passed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a nature check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And there are people about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are people about and some of them are just passing, not paying mind, and few of them stop and glance at these very well-dressed, very dangerous-looking figures that have now just walked up and look out past the ocean, but no one's broaching any conversation. They look like they're more making a wide berth or keeping a very untrusting eye on you as they walk past.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Druid's doing interpretive dance again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what did you get?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm a motherfucking human barometer!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you roll?

lines.name: TRAVIS, MARISHA
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh shit! Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I'm really good at the check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get the sense that a lot of the snow that was in the street when you got there and the slush was from a storm that recently passed. And the clouds and the fog that you see in the distance, it looks like it's blowing away.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You there, little girl.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. (laughing) Strangely, no little girl is working at this dock. However, the person you did see that looked like a little girl is actually a generally short fellow who has a wrap over the top of his head, a swollen cheek where it looks like he might have some sort of a tooth infection who spins around. It's not a bonnet. It's a crusty looking fisherman, who is like, "Who are you "calling a little girl?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, my bad, fellow! Sorry, as you can tell, we're not from around here. Visiting. Yeah, I had a couple of questions. One, there's a volcano just off this coast somewhere, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Aye."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you know where it is? Could you point to it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Was that affirmative or surprise?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Points out to the ocean.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is he pointing in a general direction? I look where he's pointing. Can I see anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Damn it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are there boats for rent, for hire?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Maybe? Yes? I mean--"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, thank you, I think that's all I needed from you, okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I pull out a piece of gold. Do you know where the volcano is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes. What, do you think I'm a dog? What is this kind of treatment?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want to make some gold?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes! I'd love to make some gold!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then can you tell me where the fucking volcano is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There we go, straight questions." He rubs his swollen cheek side. You can see his teeth are graying and yellow. There's a little bit of blackened decay at the edges, but he grins a little bit at the sight of the gold. "I need a little more than that paltry sum."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Paltry sum? How much gold do you see every day? I pull out another piece. Is this enough?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Make it five, and I'll introduce you to my docksmen."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All I want to know is where the volcano is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "But you're not looking for a ship to rent, right? Like he said?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. (sniffles) Volcano is that way." And he points out. You see he glances over, he lines up where you can see a couple of larger rocks that are breaking out from the shore surface maybe 20 or 30 feet out from where the pebble beach ends and meets the water line. He's lining up his arm and, "That way, about five miles."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Five miles.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, use your elven eyes, see if you can see it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm going to look real hard. We're a thousand feet up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Still, it's too hard to see right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can't we spell ourselves out there?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We might want that later.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, we could. We can.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should rent a ship.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we get a ship, then when it's all over, we have a way out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Otherwise, we're walking five miles underwater.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I would rather save my 8th-level Animal Shapes in case we need to bail.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, here's three more gold. How about that introduction?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That I can muster." Puts the coins in a little pouch in the side and buttons it up and locks it. "All right. Follow me."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's your name, young lady?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Fenna."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fenna. Pleasure to make your acquaintance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You as well, lass."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I love Fenna in my salads.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Leads you guys back down one of the winding stairways, and you have to wait at certain moments. There are certain areas where it switchbacks, and it's open. You would think it's a platform for looking out, but it's more for letting people get past, and for the pathways up and down, it gets narrow on the actual stairs. But eventually, you make your way down to where these docks are, and there are three large buildings that are the hubs of most people checking in, checking out. They have a number of docksmen that are keeping tabs on what's going in and out of the dock, and what materials are being shipped in, taxing those that are using it temporarily, general business in the vicinity. He leads you over. "Now then, I'm going to introduce you to "Senth. She can rent you something, at the very least. I recommend not letting that one in. She "has a thing against the smaller folk."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. I'm being racisted against?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Look, I'm not-- You seem like a very fine lady."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Touché, Fenna. Touché.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "But I know Senth well, and if you want to make a good impression, maybe keep her outside."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're not the tallest yourself, you know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Stretches his lower back with a couple of cracks and snaps. The hunched man gets about four, five inches of height and is almost cresting about Vax height.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Look, Scanlan. The necklace is really nice on the inside. I can vouch for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm not going into the necklace.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why not? New experiences, right? Whatever it takes to achieve the mission.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck it! Fuck it, I'm not disguising him because of what he looks like! Fuck that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you standing up for me?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course I am!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I would like to argue, he just disguised himself for a solid year.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't care. That was a different reason, and if your fucking dock mistress is such a bitch that she won't give us a good deal because of him then we'll find someone else.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fair enough. I would also recommend you lower your voice. We're right outside of her door.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, what's her name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Senth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Senth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's really easy. I don't mind putting on the hat.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It is the principle, but do we have time for principles?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have time for principles immediately afterwards, when we come back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We never have before. Why start now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, it's up to you, but I don't think you should do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, let's stand on principle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Are we done here?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, you're still here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good day."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thanks for your time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a modest two-story building looks like it has like a watch tower second story and the bottom floor is much larger. The door is currently closed. The wood looks a little sea-rotted. You can see the edges of the wood are curling and dark and perpetually damp. Little bits of green moss and various fungus are starting to gather at the very edges of the building, but it seems to be standing and has been there for a while.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (knocking sound)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You knock on the door. A voice inside goes "Come in."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (door creak) I don't know why I made the sound effect.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We were hoping to charter a ship at great expedience to about five miles off the coast to the plume of smoke and the underwater volcano.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as the one eye, moving independently of the other, glances and looks each of you very quickly up and down and then slicks back into place. "That can be arranged, yes."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Excellent.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How long would you wish to charter this ship?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Three days?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure, yeah, probably be less than that but three days, sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you have a crew?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, we would need to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can any of us sail?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not if we want to live.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We would like to charter a crew also to maintain. We're going to be doing a bit of underwater search and rescue, so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well then."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Will that be possible?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Great. Wonderful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Three days' rental including a crew on board. That'll run you approximately 150 gold "pieces. I require, to be in case you lose the ship or don't return with it, an additional 500 to hold "in case you lose the ship. So a grand total of 650 up front with 500 to be returned upon your "return."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm sure Percival can draw something up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, but of course. I would not dream of allowing such a thing without a paper trail."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That will do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take a glance over it, Percival. Seems very thorough but nothing beyond what was requested and basically if the ship is not returned all money is forfeit. When the ship is returned, a very intense investigation and perceived state of the ship is going to be requested from an appraiser to see if any damage was taken. Yeah, it's essentially like one of those seedy car rental places that the contract says they will ding you for every damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much do ships normally cost?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 600 is very low.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I feel like we've rented a ship before.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But it was far less than this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It was far less than this, but at this point I'm saying let's blow the money.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, of course. I agree, but an entire ship I feel like would be more than 600.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We priced it out once before, and it was like 30,000.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, so she's giving us a really good deal.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe it's a shitty ship.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, that's fine. I'd prefer a shitty ship if it's cheaper.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Slaps the contract down in front. "Have we a deal?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, wait.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe you should amend that in the contract.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one eye is still looking at you. The other is (buzzing) in front of the bracelet. "I "find this acceptable in our agreement."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But wait, it just occurred to me as I was handing that over, we need platinum, don't we? That was platinum, wasn't it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe we'll just do gold instead. Sorry, can I have that back? Sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Flings it back and there is an expression of, "Of course a gnome would do that." If this was a Telltale game it would say, "Her hatred for gnomes deepens."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's fine. (bling)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right." Immediately puts it into a small shelf, writes down some remarks on it. "Very "well, I will show you to the Shore Shanty. Follow me, please."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, it sounds elegant.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shanty's a fancy name for a mansion, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Leads you out to one of the far end docks, and there are a number of decent ships and larger fishing ships, some faster-travel ships, some long boats. You see one galleon-sized ship that's just left and taken away, and on the far end there is one of the shittiest tugboat-sized boats you've seen in a while. Scanlan, you've seen boats like this and they're largely used for either relatively cheap and relatively quick messenger services. A courier ship, if you will. That's about it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we need a bigger vessel?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have a feeling you don't believe this ship will make it back, do you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, that would not behoove me; I wish to keep my ships at dock where they're safe."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Of course. Yep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's got a high-ass insurance policy on this bitch.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Clever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The crew is included. Go say hello. Hope to see you back in a few days." Whips around and walks her way back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you see her eye? It didn't move. How does that happen?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She seemed very pleasant. Don't know what Fenna was talking about. Shall we away? Do we need to make any preparations before we go?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we're ready.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we have all of the materials we need?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did we get the platinum from the bank, if I recall? I'm trying to remember.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, we'll say that that was your intent last time, that you made the conversion to platinum.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We would've platinumed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's meet the crew.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh boy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How many crew are there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of these men that are inside, that're playing cards hunched over the table, can't be younger than their early sixties. One of them has a big, thick, gnarled white beard that darkens at the tips which you can only imagine, as most hair tends to get lighter at the tips, means it's crusted with stuff. They're both wearing general seafaring garb and tattered clothing. They're muscular. Their skin is very tanned. One of them's wearing a heavy knitted cap that folds back onto itself and rests on his shoulder to the side. They are both playing cards and they look over. "I "guess it's time to work." Takes the cards, pulls them up from the table. "All right, where we "going?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You strapping young lads are taking us out to the volcano.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, Scaldseat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both look at each other. "All right, let's wake up Santy."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Santy? Shanty.

lines.name: MATT, SAM
lines.text: Santy.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The name of the boat is the Sea Shanty, but the captain is Santy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Santy of the Shanty. Technically, this is Captain Santy of the Shore Shanty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The Shore Shanty?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. It's a mouthful.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Captain Santy of the Shore Shanty? I love it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as this large gentleman walks over and slams his fist on this small, wooden-- ugh, my brain isn't working. Thank you, a hatch in the ground. "We've got customers." And you hear this rustling beneath and all of a sudden the hatch slams up, and barreling out from underneath you see the drunkest, most unshaven, unwashed, gnarled goliath you've ever seen. No facial hair, but bits of frizzled dark hair in the back, which is interesting. Very few goliaths grow hair. Now what's interesting about this, too, is the size isn't as large as you height-wise, but width is about matching yours, so this is a bowling ball of a goliath. Steps up on the top. (grunts)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Only taller.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A large Danny DeVito.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, yeah, that's a good point. But if Danny DeVito also was doing Iron Man competitions for a number of years and then let himself go, so he has the bulk of the muscle underneath but then-- Yeah. Doesn't say a word, just looks at you all and then walks out onto the deck of the ship.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I look down into the hatch where he came from? Can I see anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is just what we need.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is dark, but you can smell the rum.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's rum down there. Down there? There is rum.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, we have five miles ahead of us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's get shit-housed. Who cares what our responsibilities are?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How long would it take to go five miles on this fabulous ship?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, one of the two older gentlemen that were there, the one that knocked on the hatch, goes, (hums). Sticks his hand out the side of the doorway, "Maybe two hours? Three hours?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Whatever. You know what I'm saying. (wind noises)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We haven't even left the dock yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They pull the sail up, they get everything ready, they go ahead and undock from the dock, pull up anchor, and the general wind, because it's cliffside here, the wind is pretty strong right here at the bay, so immediately the sail billows open and the ship takes off. And they begin to curve in the direction, loosely, of where you were pointed earlier.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: After those initial winds, I take them and keep us going for a little bit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to keep an eye on where the little guy said the volcano was and try to make sure our drunk captain is taking us to the right place.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: After all, we are going on a three-hour tour.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Actually, it should be only about half an hour, now!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Appreciate the sound effects. If we're going on a three-hour tour, I demand to know who's Gilligan, who's the Skipper, millionaire and his wife. The movie star--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ginger.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ginger, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, then there's the Professor and Mary Ann. Yeah. Well, you may be the Professor. So maybe you're Mary Ann. Does that make me Ginger?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, wait. Wouldn't you be Thurston Howell III?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel like Thurston's better.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Actually, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're Mary Ann, you're Professor.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is going to be very helpful against Vecna.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're the crazy monkey on the island that kept fucking shit up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Little buddy!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you set sail, the wind picks up, speed is enhanced and you gather at this rate probably in under two hours you'll probably make it to the destination with the help of the Air Ashari--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a 2nd-level spell. Gust of Wind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as it guides on, Captain Santy stands at the front of the ship glancing out, this giant square jaw just nestled right into where the pecs meet up beneath the thick sweater that's almost hanging off the arms at this point. No cap, balding head with the scraggly hair in the back, and just looks off in the distance. The rest of the two are just sitting back where there are various jugs of some unseen liquid, keeping tabs on the sail. It's a very leisurely, lackadaisical energy on this ship.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How many feet, I guess, is this ship from front to back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Front to back, I'd say it's about 25 feet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're crammed on this thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is a tiny ship. It's 25 to 30 feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's no way to go any faster on this? Is there no way to go faster, Captain?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Captain? You say this to the captain? He goes--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you go out to this volcano often? Lovely.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Santy is so wise.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why do you say that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He sees the sea. Look at him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can all see the sea. It's right there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Santy of the Shanty seas sees the sea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And he points out and you glance out at where Santy of the Shore Shanty is, and you can see in the distance there's a little line of dark that is rising out of the ocean.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you found it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Santy of the Shore Shanty spotted--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I will throw something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you think Santy of the Shore Shanty sells sea shells?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Surely not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually, you get within maybe 30, 40 feet of where it breaks the surface there, and the sails fall into loose and are tied around the bottom, anchor is thrown off the side, chain is let down, and then eventually the captain turns back and--

lines.name: LAURA, SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jeez. Hold on. I saw you drop anchor. Do you have an idea of how deep it is here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glances over the side.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Very deep. Is your chain long enough for your anchor to hit bottom? Cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sorry do you-- do you talk, ever?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As soon as you say that question, the two other older gnarled gentlemen on the ship go (noises of warning). Captain is just staring at you. (spits) Spits on the ground before you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I see you're also skilled in interpretive dance. You're very good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh shit. The ship will be gone when we come back up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's just go on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's do this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Water Breathing!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, and Trinket!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And Trinket. (poof)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I had him in the necklace because it was such a tiny little boat, but now he's out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. All right. With that, you all have water breathing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh wait, can he swim? He's good. He did it before, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. He's as good at swimming as half of your party.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's an expert now after the kraken fight.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm so glad I don't have to do that. You just do it for me. It's very nice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth uses Alter Self to give herself the gill hands. The webbed fingers again. That was cool.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You got to do a proper paddy entry into the water. (splash)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect. As each of you make your way into the water (splashing). You can smell, by the way, the fumes. Because you see the dark color of it, you immediately envision or at least instinctively prepare for the smell of fire smoke or a fireplace. As soon as it hits you, it's a very acrid, sharp metallic smell with hints of sulfur and other chemicals that burn the inside of your nose and sinuses immediately.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In the water, going up our noses?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the proximity. Being near, you can smell occasionally as the wind blows through, a whiff gets to you. You all make your way under the surface and begin to swim down, following with your vision where the source of this dark column of fume is.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we have good visibility?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's all right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 40 feet? 60 feet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say about 60 feet or so before it gets a little murky.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think I've still got one more charge on the flashlight, if I recall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The red light?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you guys make your way... down below. Who's leading this? I should get a marching order for underwater, by the way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will go ahead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm useless and Percy's useless underwater.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Extremely useless.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy has the light, too.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll be in the middle.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll be with Percy, more up front.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll be just behind Percival.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where should I be?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're sinking faster than most anybody.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. How about I'm the down-weighter system for whoever's in the front? I'll hold onto their ankles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is Trinket in your necklace or swimming, as well?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's out. He's swimming.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so Trinket's trying to keep up next to you. Scanlan, where are you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm probably next to Percy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you guys begin making your way down. You can breathe the water just fine as you descend 40, 60 feet, 80 feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm equalizing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're breathing water. It's not necessary.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really? Your ears wouldn't pop, still?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's no air in your sinuses.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, right. Okay, cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's funny. You mention equalizing, and I can't help but try and do it myself now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Quick question. Like in space, can we talk underwater if there's no air going through our vocal cords? Cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, good. We can't communicate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say because you have the earring, it's a little garbled, but you can hear it a little bit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like that game we all played when we were growing up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can make out the gist of things, but depending on how fast you're talking, it could be hard to hear. It's getting darker and darker the further down you descend, and the water gets murkier and murkier. It also gets warmer.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Stop peeing, Vax.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (chuckles) I was waiting for it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You called him Vex.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vax, and I said sorry at the same time, so I'm peeing right now, is what I'm saying.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's billowing up at a rapid pace, and the water is getting hotter and hotter, to the point where now it's starting to feel like a sauna.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (garbled) We didn't think about fire resistance, did we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About another 20 or so feet, and it's hot enough to stand, but it's getting really uncomfortable, and with Percival's light, you can see the bottom. (soft impact) You guys all land there at the bottom of the ocean. It's so dark that outside of Percival's light and the glow around you, you only see the outline of each other from the splash-back of the light as he projects it around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does anybody have any light?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can light up my flame hands.

lines.name: TRAVIS, MATT
lines.text: You're underwater.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But it's magic. I thought it doesn't matter?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see where Keyleth is, but it doesn't add any light to the rest of this.

lines.name: TRAVIS, LIAM
lines.text: (garbled noises)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do you see anything around us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I may join in on that, because I have a flashlight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys both have disadvantage on this, by the way, because of the lack of visibility.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scanlan, don't you have Dancing Lights or anything?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can make a Fireball. (garbled) I can make a Fireball, but it will probably go out really quick.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (garbled) Don't you have a Dancing Lights cantrip or some shit like that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (garbled) No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (garbled) Lame.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see a number of small-- strangely enough, with the heat of the surrounding area, too, you can see little bursts of color within the porous rock, and with a quick glance, Vax, you can see there are bits of plant life, colorful pinks and purples that are slowly pulled into the porous rock on the outside of these vents. You can see a very faint glow in a couple of places of the rock where it looks there is still some sort of very hot, very slow pressurizing molten rock that is cooling slowly. It looks like there's this constant slow battle between the ocean water and whatever's forcing upward.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I see any-- (garbled) Do I see--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Please don't.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are there any pockets other than the main pressure point that might be a smooth entry point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now, where it's emerging, these jets of extremely hot fume that are billowing past you, it looks like there's one concentrated opening at the moment. As you walk around, it looks like it's not one central column. It looks like there's a number of smaller fissures that are all clustered around this area, and it's hard to see the separation because so much of it's mashing into one giant column as it emerges.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Yeah. All right, so it's hot water and gas coming up. If I theoretically wanted to do a Control Water spell and reverse the water inwards, could we go in through one of these tunnels? Through one of these fissures?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can certainly try.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I hate that phrase.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You've got the Death Ward. Go for it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm more thinking for all of us. I don't know how else we're going to get in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you make yourself a fire elemental, and it won't damage you if you go-- or will water fuck with you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, water will

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I could be a water elemental, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we walk around? The volcano, is it massive?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know. Your visibility vanishes about 40 feet away from you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And we're just seeing little glows in the distance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're seeing little glows within the actual areas where the fumes are spewing up. You're seeing down where the smoke is emerging. You're seeing every now and then a faint glow that appears here and there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are the faint glows repetitive, like they're coming from the same place over and over again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's just the smoke obscuring it as it passes by and occasionally gives you a glimpse.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's head towards the glow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. It might be magma coming out, though.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There are tunnels that exist already.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It might be magma. Also, if we see anything resembling an air bubble, then we know there's something that breathes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If we want to wait a few minutes, I could do a Commune With Nature.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, do that. That's smart! Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to be like, underwater tea party! (glugging) And do a Commune With Nature for a little bit. I get three questions? I want to find any easy tunnels.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Man-made tunnels.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Man-made tunnels that aren't going to bake us alive.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Any dangerous creatures in the area.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's good. And the Anvil. Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because of the nature of this, the radius is limited to 300 feet because it's considered a somewhat underground, not out-in-the-open setting.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, yeah, 300 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so. You take the minute and concentrate beneath. And with that, all of a sudden you feel your conscious extend into the rock and stone and the various forms of plant life that have made home around the outskirts of the top of this volcano's caldera. Your questions are?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are there any man-made tunnels that will grant us access into the volcano without burning us alive?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And where are they?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And where are they?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's two questions.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Man-made is not important.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How about, any tunnels?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are there any tunnels getting into the volcano?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You feel the sense of the rock and the surrounding material guide your attention, very focused, into the center of where that fume is erupting.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh. Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The Anvil is probably too far away at this point. Yeah, it's probably not right here at the top. What about these colorful plant things floating past us? Are they going to sting us and paralyze us?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we find out, from nature, how far down in the magma it is?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, what the location of the Anvil is?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm afraid that 300 feet--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But maybe it'll know how far away it is, even though it can only-- Does it work that way?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Within 300 feet, I can see the area.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Said the fantasy heroes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Hostile creatures! Hostile creatures in the area.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hostile creatures in the area?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dangerous hostile creatures. How many more adjectives can I throw in there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pissy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Irritated creatures.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Starving.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do harm. Ill will.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Terrain. Bodies of water. Prevalent plants, minerals, animals or peoples. Powerful celestials, fey, fiends, elementals or undead. You do get a very faint sense of elemental movement. You're not quite sure what that pertains to specifically, but it is moving just outside the radius of your sphere of understanding here at the top of the volcano, and it is moving slowly through rock.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Through rock.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Earth elemental.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we need to go in the top, yeah?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or through rock. You can make tunnels, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can make tunnels.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would prefer to do that than go down the barrel of the shotgun, but that's just me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Travis, can you say that with your finger flapping on your mouth please?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we concerned if I start boring tunnels into the side of this that magma and pressure will start releasing out the side?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm just saying.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's just saying.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Vax swims down towards the cone. And I think the last time I talked about the Deathwalker's Ward, I'd set it to fire, so we'll say fire.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Immune to or resistant to?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Resistant to.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is my mantle helping with the heat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It helps with extreme heat as a general weather type, but intensely dangerous heat like fire or anything, it's not going to help you with that. So you dive into the center?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I forgot. He's like a crash test dummy. We'll worry about that later.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The pressure is a lot. I need you to make an athletics check first.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Natural 20. Thanks, Matt Colville.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You swim down into the darkness and you're using your sense of balance to keep tabs on what is up and what is down, because once you dive into the middle of this pillar you see nothing. And you begin to swim down, feeling for where the gravity is pulling you and the force against you, and use that to get your bearings.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know it's probably fuck-all, but I'm going to pull out the Flametongue Dagger and try to use it as a shitty-ass--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can faintly see a little bit of it there. You do take three points of fire damage as soon as you enter the water, reduced to one. So you manage to push through and descend about 15 or so, 20 feet. You suffer another six points of fire damage, reduced to three. Need you to make another athletics check, please, as you're pushing further and further down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Same thing. Just a six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A six? It begins to push you up, you lose a little bit of ground. You take another one point of fire damage. You begin to make up, and you get partway down. You get another 40 or so feet down into it, you think. Still unable to really see anything. Occasionally, you see a glint of that light that you saw before. The little bit of glow. You take another three points of fire damage, reduced to one. It is a lot of heat, but you continue to push further. Make another athletics check, a third one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 20, total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20? (grunting) Pushing along, still making your way down, making your way down. You get probably another 80 or so feet before it seems to curve off a little bit to the side. The force of the water begins to shift a little bit. You take another three points of fire damage. You begin to see a faint bit of that glow that you were following earlier, and as you head towards it the heat gets more and more intense. You begin to push past some of the smoke, and you can see right there, looks like there's a glowing ember of rock about five or six feet wide that is molten rock that is slowly cooling as it's being pushed faintly out, but the force of the water curves off to the side and you continue to swim away from where that glowing ember is and following the path of where this push of water is. You take another two points of fire damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. I'm Ed Harris, sinking down and down and down.

lines.name: MATT

lines.text: We follow Vax.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we cast Locate Object on the anvil? Don't you have something that sends a direct path to an object?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Find the Path? But I think I have to have seen the object before. It would also burn my last 6th-level spell.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I could do it, but you have to be familiar with it. Being told about it doesn't count, does it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't have enough information to do that, yeah. You guys all emerge from the water to gather up with Vax.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'd like to lead them to where that jump is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you all take a deep breath under the water and get to the surface, you make a test breath and the air in this pocket is still poisonous and not breathable, so you guys are going to have to take a deep breath under the water and hold your breath as you make your way down that tunnel.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh fuck. Were there any other pockets of water along the way?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Shit. Get back in the water. And I'm going to solo go where I wasn't intending to, to see how far it is to get to the next bit of water. You said it was a jump over magma?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does your creepy undead brain remember how long it takes before we die if we don't breathe? Do you remember that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I walk away from her, and I go down the hall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. It's a decent jump to get over the lava. It's not a hard one, necessarily, but I want you to make an athletics check, anyway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That was a one. Ooh! Six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Six. Burn, baby, burn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Total of six?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, total of six. Already used Luck; it's done.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why does this always happen to us?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know, but I love it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You run and make a leap, and you're pretty sure you made it, but one foot (sizzle) right into it.

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: Is it the same foot?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the same foot.

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thankfully, your armor is set to resist.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And yet Vax ain't sweating it. Not anymore.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's nothing you haven't had to regrow before.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does your Raven Queen regenerate lost footsies?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (sizzle, groan) It burns and burns and burns. Kick it off. You keep walking around the curvature, and it takes about two minutes or so of brisk travel to get around the corner where you can see another pool of warm water.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Two minutes.

lines.name: LIAM
